thread.title: Corona maker Constellation Brands quarterly results top estimates

author: cnbc.com
title: Corona maker Constellation Brands quarterly results top estimates
text:
Beverages Corona maker Constellation Brands quarterly results top estimates Constellation Brands reported better-than-expected quarterly sales and profit on Thursday, driven by strong demand for its Corona and Modelo beers and premium wines. The maker of Robert Mondavi wines and Svedka vodka said sales rose 8.5 percent to $1.77 billion. Analysts on average were expecting $1.75 billion. The company also raised quarterly dividends by 42 percent each on its Class A and Class B shares. Published 6 Hours Ago Scott Eells | Bloomberg| Getty Images Constellation Brands' Corona Light is displayed for sale at a grocery store in New York. 
Constellation Brands reported better-than-expected quarterly sales and profit on Thursday, driven by strong demand for its Corona and Modelo beers and premium wines. 
Shares of the company rose nearly 3 percent in premarket trading. 
Net income attributable to the company more than doubled to $925.5 million, or $4.64 per Class A share, in the fourth quarter ended Feb. 28. 
The company's latest quarter was helped by a $363 million gain due to the recently enacted U.S. tax law. 
The company also raised quarterly dividends by 42 percent each on its Class A and Class B shares. 
The maker of Robert Mondavi wines and Svedka vodka said sales rose 8.5 percent to $1.77 billion. Analysts on average were expecting $1.75 billion, according to Thomson Reuters. 
Excluding items, the company earned $1.90 per share, above analysts' estimates of $1.74 per share. Related Securities
